formal_accuser.name: Catherine femme Jean le Maire le jeune
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: Prior accusation - claimed to have seen her at sabbat

parents.father: Chrestail (surname unknown, from Lalarmont in county of Salm)

confession.seduction_context: Approached when very angry after being beaten by her husband; initially refused, saying she wanted to serve God and he vanished. Two weeks later he returned and she yielded to honeyed words
sabbat_activities: yearly payment of a hen to be excused

witnesses.name: Marguitte femme Claudon Johel le jeune

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband of accused wanted to buy two bulls but witness refused; one bull subsequently died, other behaved strangely and had to be sold cheaply
Building a wall between latrines behind their houses; accused said witness had better earth for the purpose than she had
First husband (herdsman) threw away 'saumeure' under salt carts against her wall for fear animals would be harmed; she was very angry saying she had already lost a cow this way
She was angry because witness bought a horse she had wanted her husband to buy; also quarrel after he bought another horse for 19 ecus
Failure of his son-in-law Colas Barthelemin to pay promptly for a horse bought from Colas; quarrel primarily between the wives

harms_alleged.target: his daughter, wife of Colas Barthelemin

testimony.quarrel_subject: Failure to pay promptly for a horse; quarrel primarily between the wives
testimony.threat_quote: que sy elle luy en donnoit, qu'on diroit qu'elle luy avoit donné le mal

testimony.quarrel_subject: She and husband refused him ancient right of passage across garden; he said during quarrel that he only feared witches, and that if any misfortune befell him she was the one he would blame
Debt of 18 gros owed by accused
Damage to field allowed by husband of accused; witness threatened to have damage assessed
Accused wanted to be godfather to her child but they had already asked someone else

Her husband was drinking with husband of accused and others; she came angrily to fetch him, swearing at them all. At her husband's request, witness and Didier Charier pushed her out, and she said to Mengeon that he would repent
Wanted to buy two bulls but they refused
Quarrel in summer of previous year

Anger when her husband was drinking at Christmas time; witness said if he had such a wife he would give her the coming and going. His wife then came in and Babelon asked her if it was the devil of a good woman who put her husband at the 'farsatte'
Dispute over husband drinking

First husband Mongeon de la Voeuvre had been maire and arranged arbitration in dispute between Babelon's husband and Colas le Clerc. They were dissatisfied with speed of arbitration and asked for return of 7 gros

harms_alleged.target: first husband Mongeon de la Voeuvre

testimony.quarrel_subject: Exchanged a horse with her husband; she was angry and said 'que le diable le puisse emporter'
testimony.threat_quote: que le diable le puisse emporter

testimony.quarrel_subject: He and her husband had carted some building stone but she was dissatisfied with amount of payment because they had deducted a debt for wine. She said that the devil could take all innkeepers
testimony.threat_quote: the devil could take all innkeepers

testimony.quarrel_subject: Witness was told that Babelon said her husband should be imprisoned for allegedly injuring Perine femme Denis Bologne. Witness said it was not worthy men but witches who should be imprisoned
testimony.threat_quote: Ha comment languarde tu dis qu'il faut mectre les genox et genoxe en prison, mais tu t'en repentiras, et qu'elle auroit mieulx avoir perdu le bras que de la resembler

testimony.quarrel_subject: Found Babelon picking fruit on her own from tree whose produce they shared

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Confrontation with Catherine femme Jean le Maire le jeune, who persisted in accusation that she had seen her at sabbat

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Procureur asks for informations to be taken, and for her to be arrested if there is sufficient evidence

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Denied all charges, admitted some quarrels, knew she had been reputed witch for 6 years

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; made reproaches but no useful results

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Procureur asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Withstood thumbscrews and rack, finally confessed under tortillons on arm and leg

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Repeated earlier confessions on two occasions; asked to be executed as soon as possible

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: News received that she had retracted her confessions and managed to escape from her room. Said she wished to die but not as a witch; confessions had been forced by torture

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Procureur asks for renewed question ordinaire, and death sentence if she renews confessions

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves second torture

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Denied at first, but when racked repeated original confessions

timeline.subject: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

prior_accusations.accuser_name: Catherine femme Jean le Maire le jeune
prior_accusations.context: Claimed to have seen her at sabbat
Accused her 18 months before; subsequently discharged her

notable_quotes.speaker: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'avoit osé prendre la hardiesse
notable_quotes.english: that she had not dared to take the boldness
notable_quotes.context: Response to Marguitte femme Claudon Johel about not telling her of accusation

notable_quotes.speaker: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin (to wife of Colas Barthelemin)
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle luy en donnoit, qu'on diroit qu'elle luy avoit donné le mal
notable_quotes.english: that if she gave her some, they would say she had given her the illness
notable_quotes.context: Refusing to provide milk when asked on behalf of dying woman

notable_quotes.speaker: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin
notable_quotes.french: et sy les fortunes que Dieu nous envoye, on vouldroit dire que ce fust tous de sortillege, qu'il conviendroit bien mal
notable_quotes.english: and if the misfortunes that God sends us, one would say that it was all witchcraft, that would be very wrong
notable_quotes.context: Defense during interrogation about death of calf

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Curien
notable_quotes.french: que s'il avoit une telle femme qu'il luy donneroit l'allée et la venue
notable_quotes.english: that if he had such a wife he would give her the coming and going
notable_quotes.context: Comment about Babelon's anger when her husband was drinking

notable_quotes.speaker: Babelon femme Mongeon Voirin (to wife of Claudon Curien)
notable_quotes.french: Sy c'estoit le diable de bonne femme qui mectoit son marit a la farsatte
notable_quotes.english: If it was the devil of a good woman who put her husband at the drinking party

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Tontelat (quoting Babelon)
notable_quotes.french: que le diable le puisse emporter

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolle femme Anthoine Sabel (quoting Babelon)
notable_quotes.french: Ha comment languarde tu dis qu'il faut mectre les genox et genoxe en prison, mais tu t'en repentiras, et qu'elle auroit mieulx avoir perdu le bras que de la resembler
notable_quotes.english: Ha how you gossip, you say that one must put witches in prison, but you will repent it, and that she would rather have lost her arm than resemble her
notable_quotes.context: Threat after witness said witches should be imprisoned

relationships.evidence_text: Mother was Claudatte Neuxat - executed as witch some 20 years earlier
father was Chrestail, came from Lalarmont in county of Salm (died when she was a baby)

relationships.person1: Marguitte femme Claudon Johel le jeune
Marguitte femme Claudon Johel le jeune
Marguitte femme Claudon Johel le jeune

relationships.evidence_text: her sister-in-law Barbelline femme Colas Poirson
Told story of illness and death of his daughter, wife of Colas Barthelemin

relationships.person2: Marguitte femme Claudon Johel le jeune

relationships.evidence_text: first husband Mongeon de la Voeuvre

economic_context.details: Multiple economic tensions: debt of 18 gros owed by accused to Thienatte Ganaire; dispute over payment for carting building stone (wine debt deducted); quarrel over right of passage across garden; dispute about building wall between latrines; multiple disputes involving animal transactions (horses, bulls). Accused's husband worked as a laboureur. Multiple witnesses lost valuable livestock. Wife of Nicolas Simeon's illness cost 'much money seeking cure', and she was described as 'emaciated'. Daughter of Claudon Thonnere's illness involved expenditure of 'more than 100 ecus' with no cure found. Economic stress evident in animal husbandry losses and medical expenses.

harms_catalog.harm_description: bull died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband of accused wanted to buy two bulls but witness refused, intending to keep them and sell at profit

harms_catalog.harm_description: behaved strangely and had to be sold cheaply
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refusal to sell bulls

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickened and died in 2 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute when building wall between latrines; accused said witness had better earth

harms_catalog.harm_description: sudden illness with near-death, then instant recovery after eating half an apple given by accused
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Babelon had been angry with her because she did not want to guard animals any longer
harms_catalog.method_alleged: illness given, then cured by eating half an apple after it had been cooked

harms_catalog.harm_description: nothing came properly into fruit despite care taken
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: ongoing tension

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, bedridden for 3 weeks with stomach swollen, saying she had bewitched him
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He threw away 'saumeure' under salt carts against her wall; she was very angry saying she had already lost a cow this way

harms_catalog.harm_description: attacked by group of birds trying to take her bonnet, then next day attacked by 3 women including accused who said they must kill her, drown her, tear her apart. Unable to speak for a day, ill for 3 more days from fright and beating
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: After husband's illness and recovery
harms_catalog.method_alleged: supernatural attack by birds, then physical attack by 3 women

harms_catalog.harm_description: went blind
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She was angry because witness bought horse she had wanted her husband to buy

harms_catalog.harm_description: promptly sickened and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel with husband after he bought another horse

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Claudon Thonnere, wife of Colas Barthelemin
harms_catalog.harm_description: became very ill after 6 months given last rites; strange lump found on thigh with marks as if of 5 claws; died after expenditure of more than 100 ecus; doctors said it was witchcraft with no other cure
harms_catalog.economic_value: more than 100 ecus spent seeking cure
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Failure of her husband to pay promptly for horse bought from Colas; quarrel primarily between the wives
harms_catalog.method_alleged: strange lump on thigh with marks as if of 5 claws

harms_catalog.harm_description: died after prolonged illness; accused refused to provide milk saying 'if she gave her some, they would say she had given her the illness'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over payment for horse
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; suspicious refusal to provide milk

harms_catalog.harm_description: became very ill, all swollen, unable to eat for 4 days but drinking incessantly, feeling he was burning; remained ill for 2 months before gradual recovery
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She and husband refused him ancient right of passage across garden; he said he only feared witches and if any misfortune befell him she was the one he would blame

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, unable to eat properly, still in wretched state at time of testimony
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Debt of 18 gros owed by accused; she told witness she would repent

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost a sheep and could not find where it had gone
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over damage to field allowed by husband of accused; witness threatened to have damage assessed

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill after Babelon touched him saying she should hold him well; died in 2 or 3 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused wanted to be godfather to child but they had already asked someone else

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost a fine cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Her husband was drinking with witness's husband and others; she came angrily to fetch him swearing at them all; at her husband's request witness and Didier Charier pushed her out; she said to Mengeon that he would repent

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell out of cherry tree and hurt herself; in bed for 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel in summer of previous year; found Babelon picking fruit on her own from tree whose produce they shared

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill; Babelon sent milk after drinking which child promptly recovered
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Same quarrel
harms_catalog.method_alleged: illness given then cured with milk (suggesting she caused it)

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill and died in a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel about her anger when husband was drinking at Christmas; witness said if he had such a wife he would give her the coming and going; his wife came in and Babelon made provocative comment

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost a fine cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over husband drinking; she said he would repent

harms_catalog.victim_name: first husband Mongeon de la Voeuvre
harms_catalog.harm_description: was already ill when she came to ask about arbitration result; quickly sickened and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He had been maire and arranged arbitration in dispute between Babelon's husband and Colas le Clerc; they were dissatisfied with speed of arbitration

harms_catalog.harm_description: promptly sickened and died in 3 or 4 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Exchanged a horse with her husband; she was angry and said 'may the devil take him'

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill with strange sickness and died after 23 weeks; judged not to be natural sickness but witchcraft - emaciated and 'frenetique'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He and her husband carted building stone but she was dissatisfied with payment because they deducted debt for wine; she said the devil could take all innkeepers; later his wife reproached her

harms_catalog.harm_description: became strangely ill, continuing to eat but not developing, still in pitiful state at time of testimony
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness said it was not worthy men but witches who should be imprisoned; Babelon confronted her and made threats

Fine calf that died 2 days after quarrel

Accused said witness had better earth for building wall

Carts of salt at St Blaise where husband was herdsman
Group of birds tried to take her bonnet in supernatural attack

Carting wine from Allemaigne; supplied wine for tavern; debt for wine deducted from payment

Babelon asked if there were any estouppes during illness; went to fetch them
Lost a sheep after quarrel
Fell out of cherry tree during quarrel; shared produce of tree

Carted building stone for payment

Price of horse that died
More than 100 ecus spent seeking cure for dying daughter
Asked for return of 7 gros, half of their 'escot'
Devil gave her black powder which she tried on hen and calf of her own

material_culture.context: Devil gave her money which turned out to be pieces of wood
Tried black powder on hen; yearly payment of hen to be excused from sabbat
Multiple fine cows dying after quarrels

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; where accused lived for 4 years
Where accused previously lived; where many incidents occurred; native place of accused
Where witness 4 moved in fear of worse evils; place name mentioned in testimony
In county of Salm; where father came from
Pilgrimage site; accused said witness need not have made pilgrimage there
Man saw her crouching by stream in suspicious behavior
Multiple references to gardens: right of passage dispute, crops failing, attacked by birds in garden
Damage to field allowed by husband of accused
Called from church with news that sister-in-law was dying
Carried in the air by her master to sabbat
Asked through window if she wanted to come into street; met in street for confrontation

economic_hardship_indicators: Multiple debts mentioned (18 gros, wine debts)
Animals sold cheaply due to illness
Economic value of livestock emphasized (fine calf, fine cow, horse worth 19 ecus)
More than 100 ecus spent seeking medical cure (catastrophic expenditure)
Disputes over payment for labor (carting building stone)
Careful accounting of money (7 gros half of 'escot', deductions for wine debt)
Importance of animal husbandry to household economy evident in repeated livestock losses
Property disputes (right of passage, shared cherry tree produce)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Lawsuit by her husband against the late Colas le Clerc on account of his wife Claudatte; caused her to be reputed witch for 6 years
When accused by Demenge Barbouiller's wife of attack, husband took action and they had to commit much of their property in their defence and moved to Raon

legal_context.redress_outcome: Claimed she would have taken action against those calling her witch if she had known, but only knew by hearsay. Actually engaged in legal disputes when accused, notably the attack by Demenge Barbouiller's wife
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Managed to escape from her room on December 3, 1618

hearsay_chains.content: Was told that Babelon had said her husband should be imprisoned
Story of man who saw her crouching by stream
Wife sent servant to ask for milk; Babelon's suspicious refusal
Repeated story told by daughter about falling out of cherry tree

emotional_state_notes: Lamenting and crying in house when heard of accusation by Mongeatte
Asked to be executed as soon as possible after confession
Retracted confession, said she wished to die but not as a witch
Escaped from her room on December 3

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said she had perjured herself in previous case and was cause of her present imprisonment; she had been to 'devineresse' to find out about husband's illness
Alleged that Claudon François had had a child by a priest

third_parties.context: Visited witness 1 along with Babelon while in childbed; were talking of illness of Jennon

third_parties.context: Subject of conversation about illness; Nicolas believed Babelon had given her the sickness

third_parties.name: Nicolas Barthelemin (not same as witness 8)
third_parties.context: Believed Babelon had given illness to his first wife Jennon; if he had called her in she could have healed her

third_parties.context: Came with servant when witness 4 called out during attack by 3 women

third_parties.name: Colas le Clerc (late)
third_parties.context: Lawsuit by Babelon's husband against him on account of his wife Claudatte; caused Babelon to be reputed witch for 6 years

third_parties.name: Claudatte wife of Colas le Clerc
third_parties.context: Subject of lawsuit by Babelon's husband

third_parties.name: Mongeatte femme Jean Michel Johel (executed)
third_parties.context: Accused Babelon 18 months before; subsequently discharged her; already executed

third_parties.name: Catherine femme Jean le Maire le jeune
third_parties.context: Persisted in accusation that she had seen Babelon at sabbat; led to confrontation and trial

third_parties.name: Perine femme Denis Bologne
third_parties.context: Allegedly injured by husband of witness 25; Babelon reportedly said husband should be imprisoned

third_parties.context: Witness 1 was in childbed after birth of son Francois when visited by Babelon

third_parties.name: Collatte (daughter of witness 26)
third_parties.context: Fell out of cherry tree during quarrel with Babelon

third_parties.name: Mre Navel (devil)
third_parties.context: Name given to devil in confession; approached her 3 years earlier when angry after being beaten by husband

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a rich trial record with 26 witnesses providing extensive testimony. Key patterns: (1) Accused was daughter of executed witch Claudatte Neuxat, creating hereditary suspicion. (2) Practiced healing - could cure as well as harm (gave apple that cured Barbelline, sent milk that cured child), suggesting cunning person role. (3) Economic status appears poor - multiple debts, laboureur's wife, involved in tavern keeping/wine supply. (4) Confessed under torture (tortillons), retracted, then renewed confession under second torture. (5) Managed to escape from room on Dec 3. (6) Long reputation (6-10 years) based partly on prior lawsuit by husband. (7) Extensive animal harm allegations (bulls, calves, cows, horses, sheep) suggesting agricultural community. (8) Multiple human death allegations including high-status victims (wife of Colas Barthelemin with 100+ ecus spent on cure). (9) Change de Nancy consulted twice, approved both torture requests and final death sentence. (10) French-speaking region (all quotes in French). (11) Unusual detail: attacked by supernatural birds then 3 women including accused (witness 4's testimony). (12) Defensive strategy included counter-accusations against witnesses (perjury, consulting devineresse, having child by priest). One uncertainty: Witness 13's testimony on damaged page, details unclear.
